00011 #ifndef _FU_ASSERT_H_
00012 #define _FU_ASSERT_H_
00013 
00020 #ifdef _DEBUG
00021 static bool ignoreAssert = false; //Definition is needed in other platforms too.
00022 #ifdef WIN32
00023 #define __DEBUGGER_BREAK \
00024     static bool ignoreAssert = false; \
00025     if (!ignoreAssert) { \
00026         fchar message[1024]; \
00027         fsnprintf(message, 1024, FC("[%s@%u] Assertion failed.\nAbort: Enter debugger.\nRetry: Continue execution.\nIgnore: Do not assert at this line for the duration of the application."), FC(__FILE__), __LINE__); \
00028         message[1023] = 0; \
00029         int32 buttonPressed = MessageBox(NULL, message, FC("Assertion failed."), MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE | MB_ICONWARNING); \
00030         if (buttonPressed == IDABORT) { \
00031             __debugbreak(); \
00032         } else if (buttonPressed == IDRETRY) {} \
00033         else if (buttonPressed == IDIGNORE) { ignoreAssert = true; } }
00034 
00035 #else
00036 
00037 // On non-Windows platforms: force a crash?
00038 #define __DEBUGGER_BREAK { \
00039     static bool ignoreAssert = false; \
00040     uint32* __p = NULL; \
00041     uint32 __v = *__p; \
00042     *__p = 0xD1ED0D1E; \
00043     __v = __v + 1; }
00044 
00045 #endif // WIN32
00046 #else
00047 
00053 #define __DEBUGGER_BREAK
00054 
00055 #endif // _DEBUG
00056 
00059 #define FUFail(command) { __DEBUGGER_BREAK; command; }
00060 
00066 #define FUAssert(condition, fall_back) { if (!(condition)) { __DEBUGGER_BREAK; fall_back; } }
00067 
00068 #ifdef PLUG_CRT
00069 
00070 #define FUCheckMemory(fallback) FUAssert(_CrtCheckMemory(), fallback);
00071 
00072 #else // PLUG_CRT
00073 
00077 #define FUCheckMemory(fallback)
00078 
00079 #endif
00080 
00081 #endif // _FU_ASSERT_H_
